cat_description_old: This one is a sad story but you can be the happy ending! From her rescuer: Olive is a very affectionate girl, estimated by the vet to be around 5.5 to 6 months old. Olive is cat who really enjoys human company and to stay in arms and laps. She is still adjusting to engage with toys demonstrating to be very interested in feathered wands. Olive’s former family had two very young children; witnesses stated that Olive was excellent with them.

cat_description_new: From his rescuer: Tully arrived in my yard in early Summer 2021.  He was full of scrappy young cat vibes, bold, and ready for a fight…and then he had one (with a raccoon!) and ended up with a bad leg bite! Luckily I had a neuter appt for him and we treated the leg, put him in a kennel to recover and he trashed the place like a proper rock star.  When he returned to my yard, he scared away all the females in the colony and had various escapades such as bringing me baby possums as gifts, getting stuck in a tree, and thinking of my raised bed as a giant litter box (who can blame him).  However, over the year and a half he’s been with me he’s softened. He’d weave in and out of my legs but was not pettable. He’d still give me the occasional hiss, wasn’t touchable (except a little while eating), and swatted when feeling threatened. He is food motivated and endlessly curious so we got him a treat ball to keep him busy while we gardened. He liked to think of my yard as his and he basically never left. He’d come to my window nightly and meow for attention (and to visit one of my cats).  Fast forward to one morning in December 2022 - I whistled to call Tully to breakfast and he came with a chattering drooling jaw and kept pawing at his mouth. We thought he’d been poisoned! I got him in a carrier and to the ER and they discovered he’d broken a tooth off to the gum line and has pretty bad dental disease. Poor guy was in terrible pain and likely had been for some time (I’d be cranky too with a mouth like that). Fortunately, through a series of amazing, helpful, and passionate rescue friends, I brought him inside and his dental work will be done soon. While he’s been in his kennel he’s changed a lot.  His energy, while still sometimes guarded, has become more friendly - he’s purring, kneading, and eating off of people’s fingers and I even taught him to sit! He deserves a chance to become a house cat. He can still get startled and swat, but he is a totally different cat.    He is absolutely unable to have another cat in the house - he gets very stressed. The holding space with cats in and out has been challenging for him. ** Select Foster Pick Up (Intake) when scheduling****

cat_description_new: Buffy was found in a basement along with her 3 kittens, Willow, Xander and Oz. They were hungry, dirty, and covered in fleas, yet not scared of us. Apparently Buffy was once owned and then left behind, which would explain how social she is. She is extremely friendly and happy to have been rescued. She walked into the carrier without a problem.She's been doing great in foster - lots of energy and adores playing! She even plays fetch. From her foster: Buffy is a friendly tabby who enjoys exploring as well as taking long naps. She loves playing with toys, particularly wands and anything else with a string. She is comfortable with being picked up, but doesn’t like being held too long. She likes to roam around the home exploring every corner and climbing onto high places (think top of the refrigerator). Buffy is fond of treats, all shapes and sizes, as well as eating her meals on time and she’ll let you know if she’s hungry with some chirps. She seems pretty active and will likely do well in a home where she can get plenty of attention and may enjoy having a feline friend. She would most likely do best in a home without children as she can still be a bit skittish and nip when scared, but she is making great progress and is a total delight.Please note, Buffy has a lot of energy and can play rough! We'll help you prepare a plan to keep her occupied and on the right track but she'll need some care** Select Foster Pick Up (Intake) when scheduling****

cat_description_old: From his rescuer: Tully arrived in my yard in early Summer 2021.  He was full of scrappy young cat vibes, bold, and ready for a fight…and then he had one (with a raccoon!) and ended up with a bad leg bite! Luckily I had a neuter appt for him and we treated the leg, put him in a kennel to recover and he trashed the place like a proper rock star.  When he returned to my yard, he scared away all the females in the colony and had various escapades such as bringing me baby possums as gifts, getting stuck in a tree, and thinking of my raised bed as a giant litter box (who can blame him).  However, over the year and a half he’s been with me he’s softened. He’d weave in and out of my legs but was not pettable. He’d still give me the occasional hiss, wasn’t touchable (except a little while eating), and swatted when feeling threatened. He is food motivated and endlessly curious so we got him a treat ball to keep him busy while we gardened. He liked to think of my yard as his and he basically never left. He’d come to my window nightly and meow for attention (and to visit one of my cats).  Fast forward to one morning in December 2022 - I whistled to call Tully to breakfast and he came with a chattering drooling jaw and kept pawing at his mouth. We thought he’d been poisoned! I got him in a carrier and to the ER and they discovered he’d broken a tooth off to the gum line and has pretty bad dental disease. Poor guy was in terrible pain and likely had been for some time (I’d be cranky too with a mouth like that). Fortunately, through a series of amazing, helpful, and passionate rescue friends, I brought him inside and his dental work will be done soon. While he’s been in his kennel he’s changed a lot.  His energy, while still sometimes guarded, has become more friendly - he’s purring, kneading, and eating off of people’s fingers and I even taught him to sit! He deserves a chance to become a house cat. He can still get startled and swat, but he is a totally different cat.    He is absolutely unable to have another cat in the house - he gets very stressed. The holding space with cats in and out has been challenging for him. ** Select Foster Pick Up (Intake) when scheduling****

You cannot help but be smitten with this kitten’s loving and social personality. **** Pick the (cafe) option for pick up!****

cat_description_old: The McDonalds kittens had a rough start, battling ringworm, an eye infection, and an ear infection. They spent several of their early months in a crate. But they have completely healed (except for some minor scarring in their eye) and they have discovered the joys of life outside of a crate. McChicken (tabby) and Sausage Burrito (gray) are a really special pair. They are extraordinarily cuddly and friendly. They love cuddles, kisses, and pets. And boy, do they love to play!Sausage Burrito is the runt of the litter, but don’t let her size fool you. She can wrestle with the best of them and could race a greyhound. She is quite petite, lean, and athletic. She loves scritches on her tiny head and pets and cuddling.McChicken is extremely, extremely cuddly. He has a bit of scarring on his eyes due to early eye infections. But he doesn’t let anything stand in his way! If he were a person, I’m sure that he would be quite the adventurer. Skydiving off cliffs and climbing Mt. Everest. His joy and zest for life is infectious. His fur is very soft and he is quite loyal to both cats and humans.These babies are the quintessential kittens who have lots of love to give. They would do well with other young cats, however older cats may not be fans of their hijinks and energy. Since they are gentle and quite hardy, they would do well with conscientious children. They may not do well with dogs.**** Pick the (cafe) option for pick up!****

cat_description_old: Witness my [black, scraggly, ever-hungry] white whale! This is Moby Dick putting on his best mopey face in an attempt to score second (or possibly third) breakfast. I had been spotting this friend for nearly a year running across the busy streets in my neighborhood but had never been successful finding his main hang-out spots or tempting him with food. When another rescuer posted a picture online of a black cat with a funny ear and a gnarly wound, I was super excited to discover that not only was my elusive friend inside and safe, but that he was, in fact, a friendly cat! I'm trying not to take it personally that he always ran from me but he's happy to ask me for pets now! Moby's wound has been all stitched up and he's ready to go home and get the love he so desperately deserves!** Select Foster Pick Up (Cafe) when scheduling****

cat_description_new: Sipha is a mostly black cat with a few splashes of white. She’s a very small cat but packs a whole lot of sweetness into a tiny package. She loves nothing more than to be petted, and bonus points if she’s sitting in your lap while you do it. She’ll purr non-stop, offer you her chin, and give you loving head-butts. Her purrs are usually the loudest sounds you’ll hear from her. On the rare occasions that she does meow, they are the sweetest, quietest little vocalizations ever.Sipha was likely someone’s pet at some point, but has been living on the streets for a while. She was being fed by a kind person and has had at least two litters. As a result, while she adores humans, she’s a wary cat and frightens easily at loud noises and sudden movements. Don’t worry about her disappearing under the bed for too long, however. Just offer her cuddles and she’ll come right back out.Sipha is a very chill cat (not a whole lot of zoomies to deal with) and would do better as your one-and-only pet in a household free of children.

Igor likes to sit or sleep next to me while working and is always up for playing whether it is with his own or Bean’s tail or jumping high to reach a doorknob.  Both are purr balls.  Igor is a little shy, and will still come and get his affection when he wants.  Bean is a complete love bug and likes to clean his brother or his human companion(s) once he gets going.  So, lots of sweet licks from Bean. They are adorably chatty when it is time for food.  Bean is a bit more talkative than Igor.  Igor and Bean will be warm companions for your home.

She was rescued from a backyard in Brooklyn and her former temporarybed was lined with newspapers, the front page of which had an article about Spencer Dinwiddiefrom the Brooklyn Nets in all caps. She happened to be sitting on the ‘din’ when it was decidedwe needed to name her. Widdie has stuck ever since. She loves people, is very trusting, andmore wonover by attention than food. cat_description_old: From her current fosterer: Birdie is a sweet, happy-spirited girl. She is subtle with her affection at first, but after a few days, she will always be around you purring. She will push her head to your hand for pets and stretch her front legs for hugs when you go near her. She loves people – she will greet anyone with affection by rubbing her body against them. Birdie also adores her pet mouse, and even plays by herself.

The McDonalds kittens had a rough start, battling ringworm, an eye infection, and an ear infection. They spent several of their early months in a crate. But they have completely healed (except for some minor scarring in their eye) and they have discovered the joys of life outside of a crate. Small Fries (orange tabby) is no longer small. He has become quite the cuddlebug! He makes a great sleeping companion and quite enjoys pets. He has a moderate level of energy, so he’s neither bouncing off the walls or a total cat bed potato. The perfect level of kitten playfulness and zen. Cheeseburger could definitely be a kitty model. She is a dilute tabby with faint shades of orange, including a slice of cheddar cheese on her forehead. She enjoys pets before dinnertime and laying around like she owns the place.These shyer kittens would do well in a quiet household, perhaps with very friendly cats. They may do well with patient children, but may not do well with a dog.

Sipha is a mostly black cat with a few splashes of white. She’s a very small cat but packs a whole lot of sweetness into a tiny package. She loves nothing more than to be petted, and bonus points if she’s sitting in your lap while you do it. She’ll purr non-stop, offer you her chin, and give you loving head-butts. Her purrs are usually the loudest sounds you’ll hear from her. On the rare occasions that she does meow, they are the sweetest, quietest little vocalizations ever.Sipha was likely someone’s pet at some point, but has been living on the streets for a while. She was being fed by a kind person and has had at least two litters. As a result, while she adores humans, she’s a wary cat and frightens easily at loud noises and sudden movements. Don’t worry about her disappearing under the bed for too long, however. Just offer her cuddles and she’ll come right back out.Sipha is a very chill cat (not a whole lot of zoomies to deal with) and would do better as your one-and-only pet in a household free of children.

From their fosterer: Bella and Clara are the sweetest bonded sisters. They are about 6 months old and were rescued off the streets. They’ve come so far since they were rescued and show every day how much they love being indoor kitties. These sisters love curling up together on a sunny couch or in their bed. They also love playing with wand toys, wrestling down the hall and exploring every inch of the apartment. Bella is a purr machine and adored attention. She can’t get enough morning pets, night time snuggles and really any opportunity to hang. Clara’s love language is quieter, but once you swaddle her in a blanket or towel, know she’s in her happy place. She lives for some behind the ear scratches. Together they are quite a special pair.Bella and Clara let us clip their nails with no problems and aren’t into scratching surfaces other than their scratch pads. After their time on the street, they really don’t like outside noise, so a quiet home is important for them. Two low-maintenance kitties with so much love to give!

This is the sweetest, most amazing, older lady. She lives for pets and snuggles. She has hyperthyroidism, which is no big deal! It just means she gets two easy, tiny slivers of pill a day (she eats them happily in her food) and she has to swing by once every 6 weeks for a quick blood test. This is the calm, easy foster cat of your dreams!** Select Foster Pick Up (Cafe) when scheduling****

His ruggedly handsome demeanor and bigcheeks will lure you in for cuddles, and he never fails to love you back.Spotted eating garbage on the side of the road, he came running as soon as we opened a can of real cat food. This little guy deserves a family who will commit to him forever, having struggled for several years on the street.

cat_description_old: Sparkle! Excuse the terrible picture but Sparkle is an unexpected addition. Trapped for TNR, Sparkle ended up showing a softer side. cat_description_new: Sparkle is still in his shy boy era but is slowly making progress, learning to trust people andenjoy his new life indoors and off the streets where he was not living his best, well deservedSparkle life.He has the most gorgeous green eyes and little flecks of white throughout his otherwise allblack silky coat. He also has a sweet little tuft of white on his chest. His left eye is a little cloudyfrom a previous injury and will remain so, but he isn’t in any pain - it just adds to his cute factor.He still prefers to dine alone but is not picky and will eat up any food or treats he gets in recordtime. He also enjoys his daily churu, which most days he feels brave enough to eat from hand.He is a very chill boy who happily snoozes the day away with his little legs sprawled out of hisfavorite cat box. He is starting to tolerate pets on the head and despite being weary I think hewill soon realize that he actually does enjoy them alot. He gives himself away by the way hiseyes close and he can’t help but lean into the love. Recently he has begun to play with toys andit is so very sweet to witness him being a regular ol’ playful cat.On a few occasions when surprised or taken off guard he has hissed to show his fear. His newfamily will need to be slow and steady with him and continue to show him how safe he is now. Ihave no doubt that the sweetest most laid back cat is inside just waiting to feel comfortable andconfident enough to fully show his true self. When he learns to fully trust, whoever gets thepleasure of being his new family will get the best reward of seeing this sweet boy learn whatlove is.

From his rescuer: Bandito was found in Bensonhurst Brooklyn wandering around the block where neighbors believed he belonged to a local Deli. Nobody knows where Bandito came from but he stayed in the area, surviving by eating from trash cans and sheltering in porches during wintertime. Nobody paid him attention until a foreigner from SI decided to rescue him and bring him back to health until his rightful owner claimed him… but Bandito waited in vain. Nobody responded to the flyers the good Samaritan posted about Bandito by street poles, asking around in the local businesses where Bandito was found, nor at the lost and found online pages.Bandito is a love bug. He loves to be pet, to be paid attention and won’t stop moving around showering his humans how much love he can give. He loves to give headbutts, offer his belly to be rubbed, and even do air biscuits purring loudly when content. Bandito seems to be very picky with his food but he just eats when he is hungry. He can also be vocal, especially if he wants attention to continue with the pet session or to let his humans know when he needs to eat ☺. Bandito is also very independent and playful. He loves the plastic springs, rattle mice toys, he will play alone chasing his ‘preys’ until he is out of breath. Bandito is also a pacifist. He will never bother or respond to any provocations from other cats to engage in a ‘quarrel’. Bandito can easily be picked up in arms and be transported anywhere, he is just not a cat to stay in arms to cuddle for long periods of time. He seems to be a half lap kitty as he likes to sit and spend time with his human with half his body on the lap.Please pick (cafe) pick up option!

She was rescued from a backyard in Brooklyn and her former temporarybed was lined with newspapers, the front page of which had an article about Spencer Dinwiddiefrom the Brooklyn Nets in all caps. She happened to be sitting on the ‘din’ when it was decidedwe needed to name her. Widdie has stuck ever since. She loves people, is very trusting, andmore wonover by attention than food. cat_description_old: Found wandering Brownsville demanding a ride, Ballad of is clearly an indoor cat fallen on hard times. Luckily, she's not letting that stop her from being the most charming, most loving, most hilarious little thing we've met all week. This little lady likely wants a friend, so please don't plan on foster-failing her as a single!

From their fosterer: Bella and Clara are the sweetest bonded sisters. They are about 6 months old and were rescued off the streets. They’ve come so far since they were rescued and show every day how much they love being indoor kitties. These sisters love curling up together on a sunny couch or in their bed. They also love playing with wand toys, wrestling down the hall and exploring every inch of the apartment. Bella is a purr machine and adored attention. She can’t get enough morning pets, night time snuggles and really any opportunity to hang. Clara’s love language is quieter, but once you swaddle her in a blanket or towel, know she’s in her happy place. She lives for some behind the ear scratches. Together they are quite a special pair.Bella and Clara let us clip their nails with no problems and aren’t into scratching surfaces other than their scratch pads. After their time on the street, they really don’t like outside noise, so a quiet home is important for them. Two low-maintenance kitties with so much love to give!

Living on busy Van Siclen Ave in East NY and scrounging for garbage has made them both very chill and relaxed. From his rescuer: Bandito was found in Bensonhurst Brooklyn wandering around the block where neighbors believed he belonged to a local Deli. Nobody knows where Bandito came from but he stayed in the area, surviving by eating from trash cans and sheltering in porches during wintertime. Nobody paid him attention until a foreigner from SI decided to rescue him and bring him back to health until his rightful owner claimed him… but Bandito waited in vain. Nobody responded to the flyers the good Samaritan posted about Bandito by street poles, asking around in the local businesses where Bandito was found, nor at the lost and found online pages.Bandito is a love bug. He loves to be pet, to be paid attention and won’t stop moving around showering his humans how much love he can give. He loves to give headbutts, offer his belly to be rubbed, and even do air biscuits purring loudly when content. Bandito seems to be very picky with his food but he just eats when he is hungry. He can also be vocal, especially if he wants attention to continue with the pet session or to let his humans know when he needs to eat ☺. Bandito is also very independent and playful. He loves the plastic springs, rattle mice toys, he will play alone chasing his ‘preys’ until he is out of breath. Bandito is also a pacifist. He will never bother or respond to any provocations from other cats to engage in a ‘quarrel’. Bandito can easily be picked up in arms and be transported anywhere, he is just not a cat to stay in arms to cuddle for long periods of time. He seems to be a half lap kitty as he likes to sit and spend time with his human with half his body on the lap.Please pick (cafe) pick up option!

cat_description_old: Little is known about Jemma's history, but she is a friendly cat that somehow ended up living in a colony outside of a Home Depot in Brooklyn. Her rescuer is pretty sure she has lived there for a few years.  She is a gentle cutie with a meek raspy voice. We would love to transition this poor baby into indoor life to live out the rest of her years in safety. Can you help her out? As you can see, she's a big fan of a good cheek scritch....Jemma was recently caught in a trap meant for a racoon and was consequently covered in wet marshmallows. All of the goop necessitated a pretty full shave so she is looking a little ridiculous but is so soft and sweet. The vet also believes she is blind. Caring for a blind cat is easy, it's magical to see them navigate!** Choose (cafe) type pick up appointment! ***

cat_description_old: Sparkle is still in his shy boy era but is slowly making progress, learning to trust people andenjoy his new life indoors and off the streets where he was not living his best, well deservedSparkle life.He has the most gorgeous green eyes and little flecks of white throughout his otherwise allblack silky coat. He also has a sweet little tuft of white on his chest. His left eye is a little cloudyfrom a previous injury and will remain so, but he isn’t in any pain - it just adds to his cute factor.He still prefers to dine alone but is not picky and will eat up any food or treats he gets in recordtime. He also enjoys his daily churu, which most days he feels brave enough to eat from hand.He is a very chill boy who happily snoozes the day away with his little legs sprawled out of hisfavorite cat box. He is starting to tolerate pets on the head and despite being weary I think hewill soon realize that he actually does enjoy them alot. He gives himself away by the way hiseyes close and he can’t help but lean into the love. Recently he has begun to play with toys andit is so very sweet to witness him being a regular ol’ playful cat.On a few occasions when surprised or taken off guard he has hissed to show his fear. His newfamily will need to be slow and steady with him and continue to show him how safe he is now. Ihave no doubt that the sweetest most laid back cat is inside just waiting to feel comfortable andconfident enough to fully show his true self. When he learns to fully trust, whoever gets thepleasure of being his new family will get the best reward of seeing this sweet boy learn whatlove is.

cat_summary_old: From his rescuer: Bandito was found in Bensonhurst Brooklyn wandering around the block where neighbors believed he belonged to a local Deli. Nobody knows where Bandito came from but he stayed in the area, surviving by eating from trash cans and sheltering in porches during wintertime. Nobody paid him attention until a foreigner from SI decided to rescue him and bring him back to health until his rightful owner claimed him… but Bandito waited in vain. Nobody responded to the flyers the good Samaritan posted about Bandito by street poles, asking around in the local businesses where Bandito was found, nor at the lost and found online pages.Bandito is a love bug. He loves to be pet, to be paid attention and won’t stop moving around showering his humans how much love he can give. He loves to give headbutts, offer his belly to be rubbed, and even do air biscuits purring loudly when content. Bandito seems to be very picky with his food but he just eats when he is hungry. He can also be vocal, especially if he wants attention to continue with the pet session or to let his humans know when he needs to eat ☺. Bandito is also very independent and playful. He loves the plastic springs, rattle mice toys, he will play alone chasing his ‘preys’ until he is out of breath. Bandito is also a pacifist. He will never bother or respond to any provocations from other cats to engage in a ‘quarrel’. Bandito can easily be picked up in arms and be transported anywhere, he is just not a cat to stay in arms to cuddle for long periods of time. He seems to be a half lap kitty as he likes to sit and spend time with his human with half his body on the lap.Please pick (cafe) pick up option!

cat_summary_old: Buffy was found in a basement along with her 3 kittens, Willow, Xander and Oz. They were hungry, dirty, and covered in fleas, yet not scared of us. Apparently Buffy was once owned and then left behind, which would explain how social she is. She is extremely friendly and happy to have been rescued. She walked into the carrier without a problem.She's been doing well in foster - lots of energy and adores playing! She even plays fetch. From her foster: Buffy is a friendly tabby who enjoys exploring as well as taking long naps. She loves playing with toys, particularly wands and anything else with a string. She is comfortable with being picked up, but doesn’t like being held too long. She likes to roam around the home exploring every corner and climbing onto high places (think top of the refrigerator). Buffy is fond of treats, all shapes and sizes, as well as eating her meals on time and she’ll let you know if she’s hungry with some chirps. She seems pretty active and will likely do well in a home where she can get plenty of attention and may enjoy having a feline friend. She would most likely do best in a home without children as she can still be a bit skittish and nip when scared, but she is making great progress and is a total delight.Please note, Buffy has a lot of energy and can play rough! We'll help you prepare a plan to keep her occupied and on the right track but she'll need some dedication.** Select Foster Pick Up (cafe) when scheduling****

cat_summary_old: From her fosterer: Castle is the sweetest friend to have around the house. She might be a little slow to warm up to you at first, but once you have won her loyalty, this tabby won’t be afraid to follow you around, nudge, and nuzzle you. She will greet you at the door when you come home each day and will meow when she’s hungry or when she wants you to wake up and give her attention. She goes absolutely crazy for chicken treats and will climb onto your lap for one. Castle is independent, explorative, and confident, and a sweet household companion who takes great interest in all that her humans do. She does have some kidney issues, which are currently stable but requires a special food – which, luckily, she loves. ** Select Foster Pick Up (Cafe) when scheduling****

cat_description_old: From his rescuer: Bandito was found in Bensonhurst Brooklyn wandering around the block where neighbors believed he belonged to a local Deli. Nobody knows where Bandito came from but he stayed in the area, surviving by eating from trash cans and sheltering in porches during wintertime. Nobody paid him attention until a foreigner from SI decided to rescue him and bring him back to health until his rightful owner claimed him… but Bandito waited in vain. Nobody responded to the flyers the good Samaritan posted about Bandito by street poles, asking around in the local businesses where Bandito was found, nor at the lost and found online pages.Bandito is a love bug. He loves to be pet, to be paid attention and won’t stop moving around showering his humans how much love he can give. He loves to give headbutts, offer his belly to be rubbed, and even do air biscuits purring loudly when content. Bandito seems to be very picky with his food but he just eats when he is hungry. He can also be vocal, especially if he wants attention to continue with the pet session or to let his humans know when he needs to eat ☺. Bandito is also very independent and playful. He loves the plastic springs, rattle mice toys, he will play alone chasing his ‘preys’ until he is out of breath. Bandito is also a pacifist. He will never bother or respond to any provocations from other cats to engage in a ‘quarrel’. Bandito can easily be picked up in arms and be transported anywhere, he is just not a cat to stay in arms to cuddle for long periods of time. He seems to be a half lap kitty as he likes to sit and spend time with his human with half his body on the lap.Please pick (cafe) pick up option!

cat_description_old: From his rescuer: Bandito was found in Bensonhurst Brooklyn wandering around the block where neighbors believed he belonged to a local Deli. Nobody knows where Bandito came from but he stayed in the area, surviving by eating from trash cans and sheltering in porches during wintertime. Nobody paid him attention until a foreigner from SI decided to rescue him and bring him back to health until his rightful owner claimed him… but Bandito waited in vain. Nobody responded to the flyers the good Samaritan posted about Bandito by street poles, asking around in the local businesses where Bandito was found, nor at the lost and found online pages.Bandito is a love bug. He loves to be pet, to be paid attention and won’t stop moving around showering his humans how much love he can give. He loves to give headbutts, offer his belly to be rubbed, and even do air biscuits purring loudly when content. Bandito seems to be very picky with his food but he just eats when he is hungry. He can also be vocal, especially if he wants attention to continue with the pet session or to let his humans know when he needs to eat ☺. Bandito is also very independent and playful. He loves the plastic springs, rattle mice toys, he will play alone chasing his ‘preys’ until he is out of breath. Bandito is also a pacifist. He will never bother or respond to any provocations from other cats to engage in a ‘quarrel’. Bandito can easily be picked up in arms and be transported anywhere, he is just not a cat to stay in arms to cuddle for long periods of time. He seems to be a half lap kitty as he likes to sit and spend time with his human with half his body on the lap.Please pick (cafe) pick up option!

He loves to run around and attack anything left on the floor when he has the zoomies, but will extra appreciate it if you play fetch with him! He adores people and his big foster brother, and will follow both of them around, sometimes getting a bit under foot in his quest for attention. After giving each other grooming sessions they often fall asleep embracing like an adorable yin yang. Just watch your feet at night because anything moving under a blanket might get pounced on! They get along very well with their older foster brother, so should have no problem acclimating to other household pets.

Because of her white face and pink lips she looks like she’s got a permanent blep, which is just adorable.This tuxedo duo are great if you want a lot of interaction or to just watch them chase each other around, and listen to them chirp and purr. They get along very well with their older foster brother, so should have no problem acclimating to other household pets.

cat_description_new: From their current fosterer: These one-year-old playful balls of energy will have you laughing at their antics and will definitely make their presence felt in your home. They love to play, whether it’s chasing each other madly around during their morning and evening zoomies, or pouncing on each other during their daily wrestling matches. Like all young cats, they are fond of toys, boxes, and any small object they can bat around and play with. They enjoy spending time looking out the window, surveilling everything happening outside. (Watch out plants, they might like to use you as toys too!)Dipsy (black and white boy) is the braver, more inquisitive and more confident of the pair.. He loves snuggles, whether it’s being your big or little spoon, and regularly seeks out affection during the day. He trills to get your attention and frequently asks for pets. He’ll follow you from room to room, making sure you’re still there, and will often come when called.Tinky Winky (tabby girl) is the shyer of the pair and likes her space. She likes to interact on her own terms, and while not fond of pets, she does enjoy interacting with feet through the bed covers.They both love food and will come running as soon as they hear the crack of the food can or the rustle of the dry food bag. They’re wild about Churus - Dipsy, in particular, can sniff out a freshly opened packed from the other side of the apartment and will rush to get some into his belly immediately! Tinky Winky loves Churus too, although is more reserved about asking for it.These sweet young cats would do well with a single adopter or a work from home couple, who will give them the time and patience they need to feel comfortable around new people and the confidence to open up in their own way.

cat_description_old: Hurricane is a super brave and incredibly affectionate little boy. He loves to run around and attack anything left on the floor when he has the zoomies, but will extra appreciate it if you play fetch with him! Just like a dog, he will retrieve his mouse toy when it’s thrown. He adores people and his big foster brother, and will follow both of them around, sometimes getting a bit under foot in his quest for attention. He’s constantly trying to cuddle up to you and purr for pets, and when it’s time to sleep there’s nothing he enjoys more than a warm lap. Once he gets settled in, he’s basically a ragdoll; you can even trim his nails without him batting an eye.Tsunami is shyer than her brother, but her trust is easy to earn with treats and playtime sessions. She loves to chase a feather on a stick and play hide and pounce with Hurricane. She’s not quite a lap cat but once she gets to know you she will happily accept pets at nap time, often flopping over to purr when she finally lets her guard down and remembers she loves to be pampered. Because of her white face and pink lips she looks like she’s got a permanent blep, which is just adorable.This tuxedo duo are great if you want a lot of interaction or to just watch them chase each other around, and listen to them chirp and purr. After giving each other grooming sessions they often fall asleep embracing like an adorable yin yang. Just watch your feet at night because anything moving under a blanket might get pounced on! They get along very well with their older foster brother, so should have no problem acclimating to other household pets.

cat_description_old: From her rescuer: Lola was rescued outside a deli store at 3:30am, she was meowing her heart out and followed a local colony care taker who called her to offer her food. She was not interested in food at all and started to rub herself against the ground and legs of the caretaker. Lola seemed clean, well groomed, extremely friendly with some Abyssinian cat patterns on her fur. Flyers were posted around the block where she was found. She was also posted on lost and found websites. However, nobody claimed her. It was also believed that she belonged to the deli-store but they denied ownership. While waiting for her rightful owner to appear, Lola was fully vetted and microchipped.She is currently being held at the rescuer’s home and she has demonstrated to be very needy of human contact, very chatty, and interested toy-rattle mice. However, she is not doing so great with the rescuers’ resident cats. Maybe Lola needs a very slow introduction to new cats but she tends to growl, hiss and spike up when she sees another cat, even though the other cat has not even noticed her presence.  Rescuer believes she would do better as a solo cat.Lola is litter box trained, she can be held in arms.

cat_description_new: From their person, who sadly has to surrender them due to allergies: Omega and Zeta are by far the cutest bonded pair ever. They are super playful, energetic, and so sweet. They respond to their names (Omega and Zeta), and they also love to cuddle. Omega and Zeta will play with anything they find on the floor, from a paper ball to anything that makes a crunching sound. They love to be petted and purr very loudly. They are super affectionate and get along well with others (humans and even some cats). They are indeed lap cats. If Omega and Zeta find you sitting, they will both try to sit on your lap. If they aren’t sitting on your lap, they are following you around the house and sitting near you. They are very independent cats, but they also love attention. They love gazing out the windows too. Fun fact about Zeta, he loves water and loves to play with it as well. They do not scratch or bite people, either. But they will give you little head rubs.Please pick an (intake) type appointment for pick up
